solution_line_template: There was a net immigration to the country of {immigrants}-{emigrants}=<<{immigrants}-{emigrants}={net_immigration}>>{net_immigration}
So the total number of people before birth is {initial_population}+{net_immigration}=<<{initial_population}+{net_immigration}={population_before_births}>>{population_before_births}
So that means they have {people_with_twins}*{children_per_twin_birth}=<<{people_with_twins}*{children_per_twin_birth}={children_from_twins}>>{children_from_twins} children
There are {pregnant_people}-{people_with_twins}=<<{pregnant_people}-{people_with_twins}={children_from_single_births}>>{children_from_single_births} children from single births

So the total number of people is {population_before_births}+{children_from_single_births}+{children_from_twins}=<<{population_before_births}+{children_from_single_births}+{children_from_twins}={total_population_after_births}>>{total_population_after_births}
